snippet: The Federal Trade Commission fears that what has become known as “native advertising,” “paid links” or “sponsored content” can confuse consumers.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission, faced with growing wave of digital advertising that is intended to look like the news articles and features of publications where they appear, is warning advertisers that it intends to vigorously enforce its rules against misleading advertising.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission fears that what has become known as “native advertising,” “paid links” or “sponsored content” can confuse consumers.

headline.main: As Online Ads Look More Like News Articles, F.T.C. Warns Against Deception
headline.print_headline: As Online Ads Look More Like News Articles, F.T.C. Warns Against Deception
